New Records: Lionel Messi scored his 14th goal in the Copa América tournament overall.
Key Match Events: Lionel Messi deflected an Enzo Fernández shot into the net to seal Argentina's 2-0 victory.
Julián Álvarez scored the first goal for Argentina against the run of play.
Jonathan David's effort was blocked by Martínez in first-half stoppage time.
Alphonso Davies was forced to depart with an apparent injury with 20 minutes left.
Tani Oluwaseyi squandered two scoring opportunities in the match's final stages.
Post-Match Reflections: Ángel Di María was withdrawn, safe in the knowledge his last game before retiring from international football will be Sunday’s final.
Canada's defeat ended their impressive progress at the tournament, although they’ll play for third place on Saturday night.
Jesse Marsch led Canada into a major tournament semi-final in just his seventh game in charge.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was played in front of more than 80,000 fans at a hot and humid MetLife Stadium.
The game was played on a strangely sandy and uneven surface.
Argentina will take on Uruguay or Colombia in the final at the Miami Dolphins’ Hard Rock Stadium.
